de.affect.appraisal

Class EEC

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.affect.appraisal.EEC

  • public class EEC
extends java.lang.Object
    The EEC class represents an Emotion Eliciting Condition. Each Emotion Eliciting Condition (EEC) is the result of an character's subjective appraisal of an emotion-inducing situation:
    1. the desirability of events with respect to the character's goals
    2. the praiseworthiness of actions with respect to a set of standards
    3. the appealingness of objects with respect to a set of attitudes
    A character's appraisal is based on three central variables: desirability, praiseworthiness, and appealingness which apply to event-based emotions, character-based emotions, and object-based emotions respectively. Besides, there are other local variables, which only affect particular groups of emotions.

    The methods of this class all throw a NullPointerException if the arguments provided to them are null.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard (based on the work of Wenji Mao and Martin Klesen)

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static EEC appraiseAction(java.lang.Object elicitor, Praiseworthiness praiseworthiness, Agency character)
      Returns a new Emotion Eliciting Condition representing the subjective appraisal of an action as being praiseworthy or blameworthy.
      static EEC appraiseEvent(java.lang.Object elicitor, Desirability desirability)
      Returns a new Emotion Eliciting Condition representing the subjective appraisal of an event as being desirable or undesirable for the character itself.
      static EEC appraiseEvent(java.lang.Object elicitor, Desirability desirability, Likelihood likelihood)
      Returns a new Emotion Eliciting Condition representing the subjective appraisal of an anticipated event as being desirable or undesirable for the character itself.
      static EEC appraiseEvent(java.lang.Object elicitor, Desirability desirability, Liking liking)
      Returns a new Emotion Eliciting Condition representing the subjective appraisal of an event as being desirable or undesirable for another character.
      static EEC appraiseEvent(java.lang.Object elicitor, Realization realization)
      Returns a new Emotion Eliciting Condition representing the status of an anticipated event.
      static EEC appraiseObject(java.lang.Object elicitor, Appealingness appealingness)
      Returns a new Emotion Eliciting Condition representing the subjective appraisal of an object as being appealing or unappealing.
      java.lang.Object getElicitor()
      Returns the emotion-inducing situation whose subjective appraisal is represented by this Emotion Eliciting Condition.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string describing the Emotion Eliciting Condition.
